conclusion: The problem involves a basketball dropped from height H, rebounding to height h, with air resistance proportional to gravitational force.
The ratio of post-collision velocity to pre-collision velocity is constant for each collision.
Gravitational acceleration is denoted by g.
The net downward acceleration during descent is g(1 − λ).
Impact speed before collision is vbefore² = 2 g(1 − λ) H.
Net downward acceleration during rise is g(1 + λ).
Launch speed after bounce is vafter² = 2 g(1 + λ) h.
The collision is characterized by vafter = k vbefore.
Substitute kinematic results to solve for k: k² [2 g(1 − λ) H] = 2 g(1 + λ) h.
Solve for k: k² = (1 + λ) h / [ (1 − λ) H ].
Calculate k: k = √[(1 + λ) h / ( (1 − λ) H )].
Condition 0 < λ < (H − h)/(H + h) ensures square-root argument is less than 1, giving k < 1.
The required ratio of post-collision velocity to pre-collision velocity is k = √[(1 + λ) h / ((1 − λ) H)].
